oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Watson Chapel AME Zion: rear of church
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Watson Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Zion
Color photograph of church's back. The 1988 wing is attached on the right to the 1922 section. Both sections feature gable roofs and brick. Heating and cooling units sit behind the 1922 section.

The Watson Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church, located in Charleston, Tennessee, was established in 1886. The current building reflects two periods of construction: the original 1922 section and a rear wing added in 1988. At the time of fieldwork, Reverend R.E. Sharp served as pastor and the church appeared to be eligible for the National Register.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings
